attributes.comment:
Dear U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services,

I am adopting a child from China. I submitted the paperwork to the Great Wall of
China Adoption Agency which was received in China April 2005. At that time my
husband and I planned to travel to China to adopt our little girl in a year. Now, it is
April 2006, and we have been told it will be another 16 months before we can
adopt our little girl. We plan to name her Alaina.

Prior to submitting our paperwork to China we had acquired and paid for the
I600/600a and the fingerprinting as required. Since these forms expire before we
travel to adopt our baby we have to renew these forms. This will cost us
considerable more money which we did not budget for.

I have some concerns. First, I do not understand the reason for the time frame for
the I600/600a and the fingerprints. It seems to me this is a duplication of time and
money for which the goverment should not be wasting. Second, why do fingerpints
need to be renewed? Fingerprints don't change. Third, I don't believe I should be
charged more by my government to adopt a child which I plan to raise as a
productive, taxpaying citizen of the United States.

Please reconsider the price increase for the i600/600a, N565, N600, and the
fingerprinting.

Thank you for your time,
Jane Cavallaro
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jane Cavallaro
